# Test cases for 0^m1^m language recognition
# Valid cases (equal zeros and ones)
# Empty string (m=0)

# Single pair (m=1)
01 true

# Small cases (m=2,3,4)
0011 true
000111 true
00001111 true

# Medium cases (m=5-10)
0000011111
000000111111
00000001111111
0000000011111111
000000000111111111
00000000001111111111

# Larger cases (m=15,20,25)
000000000000000111111111111111
0000000000000000000011111111111111111111
0000000000000000000000000111111111111111111111111

# Invalid cases - unequal counts
# More zeros than ones
0
00
000
0001
00011
000011
00000111
0000001111
000000011111
00000000111111

# More ones than zeros
1
11
111
011
0111
001111
0011111
00111111
001111111
0011111111

# Invalid cases - wrong order or interleaved
# Ones before zeros
10
110
1100
11000
111000
1111000
11110000
111100000
1111000000
11110000000

# Interleaved patterns
0101
0110
1001
1010
00101
01011
10001
01001
010101
101010

# Mixed patterns
001011
010110
100110
011001
101001
010011
